contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox single | Name = Overture from Tommy | Cover = SeeMeFeelMe45.jpg | Artist = [[The Who]] | from Album = [[Tommy (rock opera)|Tommy]] | A-side = "[[See Me, Feel Me]]" | Released = September 1970 (US)<br/>October 1970 (UK) | Recorded = Early 1969<ref name="Single">{{cite web|url=http://www.thewho.com/index.php?module=discography&discography_item_id=39&discography_tag=singles |title=The Who Official Band Website - Roger Daltrey, Pete Townshend, John Entwistle, and Keith Moon | | See Me Feel Me |publisher=Thewho.com |date= |accessdate=2012-01-07}}</ref> | Format = [[Gramophone record|7"]] 45 RPM | Genre = [[Rock music|Rock]] | Length = 5:21 | Label = [[Decca Records|Decca]], [[Polydor Records|Polydor]] | Writer = [[Pete Townshend]] | Producer = [[Kit Lambert]] }} "'''Overture'''" is a song by [[English people|English]] rock band [[The Who]], written by [[Pete Townshend]]. The track is one of three [[instrumental]] tracks released on ''[[Tommy (album)|Tommy]]'', although it does feature some lyrics towards the end; the other two being "Underture" and "Sparks". On 9 October 1970 song was released as the b-side of "See Me, Feel Me" - which did not chart - and was titled "Overture from Tommy".<ref name="Single"/> ==Song Structure== As an [[overture]] the song features samples of Tommy's most famous songs: *0:00 - 0:34 Adapted from "1921" *0:35 - 1:01 Adapted from "We're Not Gonna Take It" *1:02 - 1:35 Adapted from "Go to the Mirror!" *1:36 - 1:52 Adapted from "See Me, Feel Me" *1:53 - 2:20 Adapted from "Go to the Mirror!" with "Pinball Wizard" *2:21 - 2:58 Adapted from "Listening to You" *2:59 - 3:22 Adapted from "We're Not Gonna Take It" *3:23 - 3:50 Adapted from "Pinball Wizard" *3:50 - 5:21 Original There is no pause between the tracks "Overture" and "It's a Boy" so the songs are often combined as "Overture". ==The Assembled Multitude version== The [[Assembled Multitude]], an instrumental ensemble group from [[Philadelphia]], [[Pennsylvania]], scored with a remake of "Overture" which peaked at #16 in August, 1970 on the [[Billboard Hot 100]] chart.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=likEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA18&dq=billboard+aug+29,+1970&hl=en&ei=6l6_TaTPGNODtgfEy9ipBQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CDUQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=billboard%20aug%2029%2C%201970&f=false |title=Billboard - Google Books |publisher=Books.google.com |date=1970-08-29 |accessdate=2012-01-07}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{The Who singles}} {{John Entwistle}} {{Tommy}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Overture (The Who Song)}} [[Category:Songs from Tommy]] [[Category:Rock instrumentals]] [[Category:Songs written by Pete Townshend]] [[Category:1970 singles]] [[Category:The Who songs]]
